title.narrative: OTP 2 - JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2022, justice system authorities and related support services have institutionalized procedures and practices to protect and re- integrate children in contact with the law., which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, Moldova national systems and services are more inclusive, able to protect the rights of children, and respond to the needs of the most vulnerable in an equitable way

related-activity.ref: 5640/A0/05/501 EQUITABLE CHILD SENSITIVE SYSTEMS AND SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, justice system authorities and related support services have institutionalized procedures and practices to protect and re-integrate children in contact with the law.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the child-friendly justice system through promoting alternatives to detention, revision and development of resocialization and behavioural programmes for children in detention, developing and piloting e-learning and building law enforcement and justice sector professionals’ capacities in working for and with children, and advocating for specialized services for children victims and witnesses of crime; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
